page.title: 12"THE COKEWORKS"
page.content: THE COKEWORKS WAS OPENED IN 1953.ITS PROPER NAME IS{NATIONAL SMOKELESS {FUELS CARBONIZATION PLANT.}190 PEOPLE WORK THERE IN 3{SHIFTS}A DAY.EACH SHIFT LASTS FOR{8 HOURS.}THE COAL IS TRANSPORTED BY ROAD FROM{ROSSINGTON, {MARKHAM}AND{HATFIELD}IN YORKSHIRE AND {WEARMOUTH.}THE COAL IS HEATED FOR 23-24 HOURS AT A TEMPERATURE OF{1340 {DEGREES C.}TO BAKE{IT.585 TONS}ARE PRODUCED DAILY.THAT IS OVER{200,000 {TONS}PER YEAR.THE COKE IS STOCKPILED READY FOR SALE.THERE ARE ALSO BI-PRODUCTS MADE AT THE PLANT.{GAS WHICH HEATS THE KILNS AT STEETLEY QUARRY.{TAR}WHICH HELPS TO MAKE SOAP AND ASPIRIN,{SULPHATE OF AMMONIA}USED TO MAKE FERTILIZER AND{BENZONE}WHICH MAKES PETROL.THE COKE OVENS SHOULD HAVE CLOSED LAST YEAR BUT THE LOCAL PEOPLE FOUGHT TO KEEP IT OPEN.ITS FUTURE IS STILL{UNCERTAIN.
